To drive the point home, Samuel Jackson is the villain in this movie. Cool right? No, because they turn him into a backwards-hat-wearing teenage douchebag who spouts catchphrases and language that makes no sense in the movie. The only thing that saves this movie from a 1 or a 2 out of 10 is the action scenes that are fairly well choreographed and use slow-motion to actually show the action and it's pretty well done. Other than that though I didn't find anything worth seeing.
Best Spy Action Film In 2015 so far. Credit to Samuel Jackson for becoming a very fasinating villain. Hope they can do a sequal for this flims. Fun to watch. Worth every penny.

I love this film because it gets away from the gritty, overly serious films spy flicks have become and instead injects some fun back into the genre. Taron Egerton is a brilliant lead character surrounded by great supporting cast, such as Colin Firth, Mark Strong, Samuel L Jackson and Michael Caine. Amazing film.

It's difficult for me to just dole out a 10 rating on any movie unless I'm awe-stricken.  This movie deserves a very reasonable 9 because it delivers what movies should and that is entertainment. Screenplay was well written and the acting was very good.  Well worth the time & money to go see

There is much to like about this movie.  In particular, Colin Firth.  This film goes to show what a versatile actor he truly is.  Love the gentleman kick-ass style.  And while the movie does have more than it's fair share of violence; the gore is not over-the-top.  It is best to keep in mind that this movie deals in extremes.  If you are easy offended, this one may not be for you.  However, if you can roll with the punches and see this for the dark comedy that it is, kick your heals up and enjoy.  It's a hell of a ride.

It is agent movie but not like the James Bond movie. It talks about the secret service in a slightly realistic manner. Agents will actually die and require replacement. And the new agent is needed to be trained. The villain is actually smart and logical but not ethical. The philosophy  behind the villain is not completely wrong which is a balance between heroes and villains which is good.
Kingsman does good everything it wants to do, it is funny when intended to be, and the action is really good,  the movie has great actors. I loved it.
'Kingsman; The Secret Service' is a high octane,  blockbuster, wrapped in a thick layer of enthusiasm and solid production value.

This is one sweet ass action packed spy great movie of 2015.Taking inspiration right out of James Bond this movie succeeds in many levels.Acting is significant and the action scenes are dazzling.Everyone does such and amazing job at this movie and especially one scene in particular(those who have seen it will know what I'm talking about) it's so insane and bad-ass that makes your eyes want to pop out.Really good movie I recommend it to everyone who hasn't seen it yet,and I still fail to release why doesn't everybody love this.
Kingsman might be one of the surprise hits of 2015. I didn't see that coming. I got a lot of fun when I watched it. Glad that there are going to be a sequel.

This movie really surprised me! The previews made it seem like a hipster, frat boy, douche turned spy. Without spoiling anything, it couldn't be farther from the truth. However because of this, I did not see this movie until I saw it on HBOG. My expectations were low, but I found myself fully engulfed in the movie pretty early on. The plot is fun but the actions/violent scenes were even more fun! Not your average spy movie which is good, the humor is well placed but at times feels a bit too silly.

Great movie, great acting, great humor, great violence! I really liked how this movie was something else, something out of the ordinary, it has it's cliches, but it's funny and entertaining! Go and watch it, you'll love it!
The Kingsmen: Secret service is a over the top action comedy with a amazing cast. Taron Egerton plays the street thug turned sophisticated gentlemen. To sum it up kick-ass meets Bond.

This was such a fun movie to watch. I caught it in theatres and bought it on dvd  when it came out today.  It is a wonderful addition to my collection of Bond, Bourne, Mission Impossible films and it fills a gap those films never show.  This film does have it's campy and over the top moments, but all the actors, even the younger ones, do a phenomenal job in this flick.  I've always been a fan of Firth, Strong, Jackson and these 3 are just sooo great on screen (and there's also the added bonus of seeing Mark Hammill and Michael Caine, even if briefly) that their performances and action scenes alone make it worth spending money on.  This is a film I'd love to see get a sequel and I hope people will spend money to show support for the people who made this film possible.

For all of Kingsman's entertainment values, it's an infuriating watch. Ridden with snooty stereotypes, frustrating sequences and incoherent plot points, it's an absolute necessity to turn off all brain cells if you want to watch this muddled mess.

I enjoyed the movie and it was well done. All the actors were appealing except Samuel L. Jackson who can't act to save his life. Can someone explain to me why they keep casting this low class ghetto embarrassment in all the big movies? He's so ugly it makes my eyes bleed every time I see his mis-shapen disgusting face. And he's supposed to be an IT genius in this movie on par with Bill Gates or Steve Jobs? Give me a break.

I thought this was most enjoyable, loved the action... very Kill Bill-ish.... just a few spots were a bit slow and the end bit was a little on the lame side, I felt the sexual favors bit took away from the movie and added nothing, should have left that bit out,  but overall... I thoroughly enjoyed it and will be buying the DVD (when the price comes down... :-)

Good movie. Good Story. Cool Kills. All I like in one movie. I should gave 10 stars but i missed the beating up of the man how lives with his man. Hope an second movie will come soon. I will be ready to watch.
Very entertaining! Very funny! (I especially loved the church scene.) It's full of parody and action. Taron Egerton and Colin Firth were both good, the supporting cast as well.

I don't have much to say except that I do not understand how this scores "58", in the critic's section. I love reading film criticism but sometimes, like over here, I do believe a majority of them are way off. This movie is an insanely fun "return-to-bond", a brilliant satire and it acknowledges itself to be both. It sets itself apart visually and stylistically, and indulges in on-point dark humour. There are also some really great performances here. Colin Firth seems to be a better Bond than half the real ones were, and Sam Jack's part seems effortless, as it is entertaining.

Kingsman: The Secret Service is an example of a movie that has exquisitely balanced the elements of comedy and action. We can't expect this to be a completely serious, violent and mature kind of spy movie, because it isn't. But nonetheless, it is generally fun and hooking. Definitely deserves a 9.

One of the first 10 out of 10 ratings I've given for a movie in the past 5 or so years. An instant classic with hilarious writing, fantastic action scenes and great characters make Kingsman: The Secret Service overall, an incredibly fun and mesmerizing time.

If I start complaining, there will be a lot of characters here... so I'm just going to say that this movie tries a lot to be like James Bond. Take U.N.C.L.E. for example, and you will see what makes it unique how Guy Ritchie shows you what makes a great movie - great. The villain was the brightest light in the movie and we really didn't care much about the side characters, did we?

I am so glad I didn't listen to the reviews and watched the movie, looked entertaining so I watched it and loved it, it has a corny feel to it but it's part of the game. Very entertaining and funny. It def didn't disappoint

Although I enjoyed myself, I do think the film had some issues. The fast edited fight scenes go on way too long, it's really violent, and the film can't really decide if it's an all out comedy or drama. At times it has "Airplane" type of humour, like it's making fun of the spy genre, and other times heavy on the drama. At one point they even poke fun of product placement in movies with McDonalds, again showing the "Airplane" style of satirical humour. Somehow it all worked for me mainly due to the spirited acting by everyone involved. Not really a film I would desire to see again but fun for an afternoon.

Kingsman: The Secret Service is an example of how great I wanted it to be, but eventually ends up being the only great one in its own way. Users may love this one, but I think personally, this one should've been better.

WHAT I LIKED: This movie pretty much defines fun. Fancy some fairly light-watching, whitty and action-packed entertainment? Well not much can beat 'The Kingsman.' It's developed and involved enough to keep you engaged, but it's got just the right amount of fun and self-awareness to make it this easy and fun to watch. A great cast bring everything to life, and great direction guides the story, and the incredibly bad-ass action, to an explosive finale. It's bloody good fun.

Kingsman is a very awesome movie its violent its got charm, Colin Firth, Samuel Jackson and Michael Caine kill it Oh and also that girl with the hook legs and the fight scenes are really a work of art.

Now, I hate comic books and even more so films inspired by them. Yes, I mean you Marvel, DC etc. One of the few exceptions is this. There are many pluses, not least well know actors playing against type, notably Colin Firth ditching his diffident middle class Englishman persona for a super smooth but hard as nails secret agent. Mark Strong plays a good guy rather than his usual villainous roles. Secondly there is humour throughout, even during the southern redneck church scene. In a film full of surprises this is the shocker so much so I had to replay it just to make sure I hadn't imagined it.  Maybe the only downside is that the director chose to depict exploding heads as colourful fireworks rather than opting for a bit of a bloodbath but tis is a moot point.
Deutsche Review - Kritik

A must view, simply amazing. If you're looking for a action packed movie this one is your choice, a pretty balanced film with action, violence and a lot of funny moments, also the cast it's pretty damn awesome, Colin Firth, Samuel L. Jackson, Michael Cane etc

Violent tongue-in-cheek romp with a lead teen character. Solid send-up of the stiff-upper-lip British Bond-like spy. Cheeky and jolly good fun. Faberoony fight sequences: never knew Colin Firth had it in him, though always suspected Jack Davenport was a dab hand at the old one-two. Hope there's a bit more for the girls to do next time round. I'm sure we're in for a sequel.

Wow. My only word that comes to my big head. Its a delight to see 2010's Director of Kick Ass, Matthew Vaughn, make a strong comeback with this film. If this movie can make it on my all time favorite movie list as number 1, then you will probably like it as well as i did.
